channel.title: Why I Hate Math
channel.description: So I am currently in Honors Geometry, and i got pissed off. I don't like how they do stuff, and i think programming so for instance, they use stuff for proofs such as if and only if, and if this is right then this is right. So we had a question. If sara is eating, and losing weight, then right a condintional statement that represents this. This is what they want: if sara is eating is true, then sara looses weight. this is what i wrote: if (saraEats=true;Sara <= 1;sara--). Ofc they count this wrong... I HATE GEOMETRY

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Mine does this: possible Algebra 1 in 7th, if not 8th, then if not 9th. Then geometry, Trig AND Algebra II same year, then so on and so forth…

Read full topic

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

My school does this (which is fucking retarded imo):

Algebra I in 8th grade,
Geometry or Algebra I (depending on if you’re new to the school or failed algrebra the past year) in 9th,
Algebra II in 10th,
Pre-Calc in 11th,
Calculus or Discrete in 12th

I forgot so mucb stuff between the two algebras -_-

Read full topic

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Slope was so easy. We had a test on inverses in pre calc today and I didn’t show any work, just the answer. You can’t find it with a calculator either, the only thing you can do is graph it and hope it comes out right.

Read full topic

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

We went Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, Pre Calculus, Calculus. Got a 50/55 on the Geometry final last year, but she curves 5 questions. My Algebra II teacher is a bitch. I got a 87% on the last test because I didn’t write down the slope, make a t chart for the graphs, or label my graphs. Got 2.5 points off per graph. -.- She was like, “You can’t simply know the slope for an equation like 2x + 3y = 18.” Yeah I can. It’s -2/3… No calculators at all also.

Read full topic

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Hm…
For us, its 7th grade math, intro to alg, alg 1, geo, alg 2, trig, statistics, and calc i think…
So far, geo is the most annoying (Probably because there are so many theorms, etc, and proofs are annoying…)

Read full topic

item.title: Why I Hate Math
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:46, topic:417164”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=519100.msg3774257#msg3774257 date=1317952571]

Proofs were the dumbest thing all year. Gets easier from there. Have fun next year, pre calc is a bitch.

You forgot Algebra II in there.

@OP: Proofs are a bitch.

My school did algebra I, then algebra II, then geometry, then pre calc + trig in the same year, then calc, then stat.

Standard does algebra I in 9th grade, Honors does algebra II, and GT (gifted and talented) does Geometry. Respectively, I took algebra I+II in middle school.
[/quote]
Interesting.
I took Algebra I in 7th grade, Geometry in 8th… And I’m taking Algebra II this year (9th). It’s actually a class for Juniors (11th grade), but I imagine you meant the same.[/quote]

Yes our school just switches when you take algebra II with geometry.

Read full topic
